chapter.name: MaxScore Editor: Preferences View
chapter.p: In MaxScore you can fully customize your score according your needs. In order to do so change default view (Score View) to Preferences View. Here you can enter Score Information such as:

ul.li: First System Indent - indentation for the first system

chapter.p: You can also select elements to show (through toggle/ untoggle):
Another options to customize your score are:

li.i: - enter a value for the measure number on the first measure in the score.

ul.li: Set Hold Scaler - requires a value

chapter.p: You can also set colors for the parameters, such as:
Another section will let you personalise Fonts used in a score, such as:
Also you can set a library for Picster by clicking on “Set” and locating it in “Default Picster Lib Folder”.
You can specify options for the playback regarding your needs:

ul.li: Quantisation - from the first dropping menu select a main duration (whole Note (W), half Note (H) or Quarter Note(Q)). From the number box dropping menu adjust a number of pulses to qualify.

chapter.p: Select a time Unit (pixels/second). By default it is set to "100". A lowest possible value is "5". Click outside of the field to activate your choice.

p.i: You can also save your preferences as a preset file by clicking “Save Preference as…” button. If this option is chosen, you can use them next time you create a new score by going to Preferences View (shift+3) and selecting preferred one by clicking on “Open Preferences”

chapter.p: By clicking on Attribute List you can define user the attributes.
